line_1: See Garrick in poor Lear rave,
line_2: He seems 'gainst each o'erwhelming wave

line_1: If adverse Storms begin to rave,
line_2: Serenely view the foamy Wave,

line_1: If adverse Storms begin to rave,
line_2: Collected in yourself, and resolutely brave.

line_1: Ride o'er the foaming Seas, with Torture rave,
line_2: Bound into Air, and dash the smoking Wave.

line_1: Alas! I see thy frantic spirit rave,
line_2: And thy last breath expiring on my grave.

line_1: Distracted for her loss, they rave;
line_2: In Leder Den they dug her grave,

line_1: But when the daemons of the tempest rave,
line_2: Skill must conduct the vessel thro' the wave.

line_1: And wildly you of Grandieur Rave!
line_2: Impertinents! Content I crave,

line_1: Because our froward Children cry and rave;
line_2: While we, alas! but little Sleep can have,

line_1: ' Ye warring elements more fiercely rave!
line_2: "Where ruthless Avarice finds a quiet grave!"

line_1: There and there only (though the deist rave,
line_2: And atheist, if earth bear so base a slave)

line_1: There and there only (though the deist rave,
line_2: There and there only, is the pow'r to save.

line_1: All Night, on Beds of Down, I restless rave,
line_2: On this cold Earth, I measure out my Grave;

line_1: All Night, on Beds of Down, I restless rave,
line_2: 'Tis you alone can help, 'tis you alone can save.

line_1: Thrice happy times! — but O I fondly rave,
line_2: I'll do, — I'll plough or dig as Delia's slave.

line_1: But vain to them the winds and waters rave;
line_2: Lo! their bones whiten in the frequent wave;

line_1: For solitude, however some may rave,
line_2: Seeming a sanctuary, proves a grave,

line_1: In vain the Satyrs rage, the Tritons rave,
line_2: They bore him Heroes in the secret Cave.

line_1: A home of refuge, where no tempests rave;
line_2: But lead me where the cypress branches wave;

line_1: A home of refuge, where no tempests rave;
line_2: Beneath the turf that shrouds an early grave.

line_1: He then shall Pine, and Sigh, and Rave:
line_2: Good Lord! what Bustle shall We have!

line_1: Let none who mourn for thee desponding rave:
line_2: For Hope celestial, dawning on thy grave,

line_1: Speak you of Claudius? Let the minion rave,
line_2: Say Pitt's a fool, and Lyttelton's a knave,

line_1: Where statesmen juggle, and where patriots rave;
